content.webTitle: The best pictures of the day

fields.headline: The best pictures of the day
fields.bodyText: Fiona Shields has put together today's Ten best photographs of the day gallery and the focus today is on children around the world Dan Roberts is covering the US government shutdown and has just sent this Twitpic from the US Capitol Lifting the kimono: a Japanese erotic art exhibition opens at the British Museum featuring shunga prints that celebrate sex and are a world away from pornography, explains Jonathan Jones. See our gallery of the images in the show Boris Johnson has been entertaining everyone (including his leader) at the Conference this morning. I was interested to see this picture of Boris shot in black and white by Getty staff photographer, Christopher Furlong. Chris says, "For a few years now, conferences have become so orchestrated and controlled that it's been difficult to get anything different that sets our content apart. This year we decided to try and pare it right back and to shoot each conference as a feature, in monochrome, to offer our clients an alternative view. It offers a very nostalgic view of conference, without colour the images hark back to another era and as a photographer, it's been great to have the freedom to shoot the event in a different way." There were some atmospheric images out of Washington last night as the government crisis developed. There's a gallery of the best here. Have a look at today's Picture from the past, chosen by my colleague Ranjit Dhaliwal, it's a great image from the 1950s by Ernst Haas Read about the Tories' blond bombshell in Andrew Sparrow's rolling coverage in politics live
